intro: Lactuca haimanniana, commonly known as Haiman's lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family, Asteraceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, bluish-green leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seeds. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to survive in dry conditions. Lactuca haimanniana is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and endemic species.
